item.title: New Minor in Behavioral Data Science
item.description: A new interdisciplinary minor is now available for students interested in the intersection between data science and human behavior. The Behavioral Data Science minor combines psychological science, statistics, and computational methods to analyze, predict, and influence human behavior across a wide range of real-world contexts. Minor requirements can be found in the RPI catalog. For questions, please contact the School of HASS advising hub at HASSinfo@rpi.edu.

item.title: 11/5 Cognitive Science Colloquium - Dr. Brandon Turner
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department in Carnegie 113 on Wednesday, November 5th at noon for a presentation titled “Mechanisms of Selective Attention during Learning” by Dr. Brandon Turner of Ohio State University. Dr. Turner’s research interests include dynamic models of cognition and perceptual decision making, efficient methods for performing likelihood-free and likelihood-informed Bayesian inference, and unifying behavioral and neural explanations of cognition.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: “Leading from Anywhere”
item.description: At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. Whether it be leading a particular project or initiative, assisting others in overcoming obstacles and capitalizing on opportunities, or catalyzing co-creation with colleagues, Rensselaer community members model leadership every day.
